channel.title: Hmm.. Math bugs
channel.description:
Look heres my counter procedure. ive reduced the count on this on up to 9 digit numbers, it had 80 digit.. but, its for a p2p script.
So this is what i think is wrong with it
[ul][li]Some sort of math error, e.g. the same variable added twice or something[/li] [li]a loop error.[/li] [li]a scar error[/li][/ul]
so heres the script. please people, help me!! [scar]procedure Counter(length:integer;Decimal_LengthCounter:integer;numSystem:string); var anumber_Count,bnumber_Count,Dec_Counter:integer; var UppCase_ProcessedString:string; var dec_truth:boolean; begin UppCase_ProcessedString:=Uppercase(numSystem); case UppCase_ProcessedString of 'DEC' : begin for Dec_Counter:=0 to Decimal_LengthCounter do writeLn(IntToStr(Dec_Counter)); end; 'OCT' : begin anumber_Count:=8; bnumber_Count:=0; end; 'BIN' : begin anumber_Count:=1; bnumber_Count:=1; end; 'PEN' : begin anumber_Count:=4; bnumber_Count:=0; end; end; begin if length >0 then if dec_truth = true then Exit; for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do Wl(IntToStr(i[1])); if length > 1 then for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])); if length > 2 then for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3])); if length > 3 then for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[4]:=0 to anumber_Count do wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3])+IntToStr(i[4])); if length > 4 then for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[4]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[5]:=0 to anumber_Count do wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3])+IntToStr(i[4])+IntToStr(i[5])); if length > 5 then for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[4]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[5]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[6]:=0 to anumber_Count do wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3])+IntToStr(i[4])+IntToStr(i[5])+IntToStr(i[6])); if length > 6 then for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[4]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[5]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[6]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[7]:=0 to anumber_Count do wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3])+IntToStr(i[4])+IntToStr(i[5])+IntToStr(i[6])+IntToStr(i[7])); if length > 7 then for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[4]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[5]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[6]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[7]:=0 to anumber_Count do For i[8]:=0 to anumber_Count do wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3])+IntToStr(i[4])+IntToStr(i[5])+IntToStr(i[6])+IntToStr(i[7])+IntToStr(i[8])); if length > 8 then For i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[4]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[5]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[6]:=0 to anumber_Count do for i[7]:=0 to anumber_Count do For i[9]:=0 to anumber_Count do Wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3])+IntToStr(i[4])+IntToStr(i[5])+IntToStr(i[6])+IntToStr(i[7])+IntToStr(i[8])+IntToStr(i[9])); end; end;[/scar]

item.title: Hmm.. Math bugs
item.dc:creator: @mindtempest mindtempest
item.description:
@mindtempest wrote:

usually ppl use dec,bin, oct and hex (16). ive never heard of pentadecimal except as a numerical concept.
i have a flash actionscript one, but since as is incompatible with scar, nvm[br][size=1]Posted at: September 08, 2006, 12:13:49 AM[/size][hr]edit-just found my typo lol[br][size=1]Posted at: September 08, 2006, 12:14:50 AM[/size][hr]and since you need a base converter heres one i found made in php. mbe u can find some way to adapt it? http://www.pgregg.com/projects/php/base_conversion/base_conversion.inc.phps

Read full topic

item.title: Hmm.. Math bugs
item.dc:creator: @The_Prince_of_Random The Prince of Randomness
item.description:
@The_Prince_of_Random wrote:

No… It is NOT a base converter.

This is JUST one procedure from a bruteforcer…

Im just testing a feature which i might add into a script.

I guessed that pen is pentadecimal
or pental…
Im not sure, i found it on my calculator
it goes from 0-4

Read full topic

ya so from what i see, it is essentially a base converter although what you mean by ‘pen’ as a base, i dunno…

item.title: Hmm.. Math bugs
item.dc:creator: @The_Prince_of_Random The Prince of Randomness
item.description:
@The_Prince_of_Random wrote:

Hmm… that was what im finding out, how i could change it…
Im not sure thats the only way i can think of doing it.

Im trying to make the numbers printed go thorugh every combination of number, within their number system…

Read full topic

item.title: Hmm.. Math bugs
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

a base converter converts number systems by their base…
binary uses base 2, octal 8, decimal 10, hexadecimal 16

an integer can only hold 2^31 - 1

i would try to help you, but i cant understand what your code is meant to do, it isnt indented, and your looping looks horrible :S surely there is a better way to do it?

Read full topic

item.title: Hmm.. Math bugs
item.dc:creator: @The_Prince_of_Random The Prince of Randomness
item.description:
@The_Prince_of_Random wrote:

Um… what the hell is a base converter…
did i say 80?
i meant 40.
Sorry.

Well that script there goes up t0 9 digit.

Please, dont post her unless you want to help me with this script.

Read full topic

item.title: Hmm.. Math bugs
item.dc:creator: @mindtempest mindtempest
item.description:
@mindtempest wrote:

from c++, not sure if its relevant in scar though
an int can only take 3^31-1 as its max value. so if you want an 80 digit number it will die. (or so i think)
anyway, if you are making a base converter, there exists tons of those on the internet, and theres no point in making it a p2p script.

Read full topic

item.title: Hmm.. Math bugs
item.dc:creator: @The_Prince_of_Random The Prince of Randomness
item.description:
@The_Prince_of_Random wrote:

Look heres my counter procedure.
ive reduced the count on this on up to 9 digit numbers, it had 80 digit…
but, its for a p2p script.

So this is what i think is wrong with it

[ul][li]Some sort of math error, e.g. the same variable added twice or something[/li]
[li]a loop error.[/li]
[li]a scar error[/li][/ul]

so heres the script. please people, help me!!
[scar]procedure Counter(length:integer;Decimal_LengthCounter:integer;numSystem:string);
var anumber_Count,bnumber_Count,Dec_Counter:integer;
var UppCase_ProcessedString:string;
var dec_truth:boolean;
begin
UppCase_ProcessedString:=Uppercase(numSystem);
case UppCase_ProcessedString of
‘DEC’ : begin for Dec_Counter:=0 to Decimal_LengthCounter do writeLn(IntToStr(Dec_Counter)); end;
‘OCT’ : begin anumber_Count:=8; bnumber_Count:=0; end;
‘BIN’ : begin anumber_Count:=1; bnumber_Count:=1; end;
‘PEN’ : begin anumber_Count:=4; bnumber_Count:=0; end;
end;
begin
if length >0 then
if dec_truth = true then Exit;
for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do Wl(IntToStr(i[1]));
if length > 1 then
for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do
for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do
wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2]));
if length > 2 then
for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do
for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do
wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3]));
if length > 3 then
for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do
for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[4]:=0 to anumber_Count do
wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3])+IntToStr(i[4]));
if length > 4 then
for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do
for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[4]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[5]:=0 to anumber_Count do
wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3])+IntToStr(i[4])+IntToStr(i[5]));
if length > 5 then
for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do
for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[4]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[5]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[6]:=0 to anumber_Count do
wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3])+IntToStr(i[4])+IntToStr(i[5])+IntToStr(i[6]));
if length > 6 then
for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do
for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[4]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[5]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[6]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[7]:=0 to anumber_Count do
wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3])+IntToStr(i[4])+IntToStr(i[5])+IntToStr(i[6])+IntToStr(i[7]));
if length > 7 then
for i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do
for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[4]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[5]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[6]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[7]:=0 to anumber_Count do
For i[8]:=0 to anumber_Count do
wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3])+IntToStr(i[4])+IntToStr(i[5])+IntToStr(i[6])+IntToStr(i[7])+IntToStr(i[8]));
if length > 8 then
For i[1]:=bnumber_Count to anumber_Count do
for i[2]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[3]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[4]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[5]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[6]:=0 to anumber_Count do
for i[7]:=0 to anumber_Count do
For i[9]:=0 to anumber_Count do
Wl(IntToStr(i[1])+IntToStr(i[2])+IntToStr(i[3])+IntToStr(i[4])+IntToStr(i[5])+IntToStr(i[6])+IntToStr(i[7])+IntToStr(i[8])+IntToStr(i[9]));
end;
end;[/scar]

Read full topic
